derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent.: alteration of dialect scuff, of obscure origin
early 16th cent. (in the sense 'scurf'): variant of scurf. The word came to mean 'worthless thing', whence the current sense (mid 19th cent.)

entry.def: If someone takes you by the scruff of the neck, they take hold of the back of your neck or collar suddenly and roughly.

example.ex: He picked the dog up by the scruff of the neck.
example.tran: 他一把抓住狗的脖子把它拎起来。

means.word_mean: 1. the back side of the neck

sentences.en: The barman took her by the scruff of the neck and threw her out.
